channel.title: self training on Khaled Allen
channel.description: Recent content in self training on Khaled Allen

item.title: How to Make Your Own Good Days
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1540" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Mana_benz on Flickr"][/caption]

Last week, I had a terrible Wednesday. On that day, I did poorly on a workout I was confident I could do well in. I had to leave Kenpo early because I was so exhausted and beat up, and when I got home, I had a stomach ache. I started panicking about how hungry I was because I thought if I ate food so late I would not be able to sleep, and I was already exhausted. My mom and girlfriend can attest to how immature I was.

The next day was totally different. It was sunny, for one, and I made sure to get enough sleep. Even though traffic kept me from making some appointments, I brushed it off and wore a smile all day long. I had a great time chaperoning my 7th and 8th grade cross country team, and ended the day tired but not exhausted.

item.title: What It Means to be a Writer
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1525" align="alignright" width="300" caption="JohnONolan on Flicker"][/caption]

Since I was a little boy, I've wanted to be a writer. Back then, that meant I got to spend all day writing stories, which was something I loved doing. I couldn't imagine a better way to spend my time than telling stories about dragons and spaceships. Since that's what writers did, I wanted to be a writer.

item.title: Start Your Day Right with an Anchor
item.description:
[caption id="" align="alignright" width="300" caption="lulu lemon athletica on Flickr"]

[/caption]

The image of the lone warrior training every day at dawn is a popular one in the martial arts. Like clockwork, the Warrior rises before her companions have even stirred to run through her training. She does this in the mornings, so that there is no possibility of distraction. It is her source of strength, for even in the midst of a quest, she finds time to hone her skills and focus her mind for the day's coming struggles.

Do you ever feel frustrated by the inconsistency in your days? While change and excitement are great, I've always found that I really appreciate having at least a few things that are steady that I can turn to in order to get into the right mindset for the day. Alternatively, having something later in the day that I can expect helps me forget all the troubles and problems that have cropped up. An afternoon run will do wonders to help you put the stresses of a long workday behind you so that you can focus your energies on being with your family in the evening.
